description:
This is still one of the Best Pizza's I've ever tasted, and that includes everything else in S.F., which are all also very, very great in their own regard...but this one's just very unique.

The New Location across the street from the Old Place...the effort to get the dough "just right"...and the sauce, and the cheese, and everything else; it's truly inspiring.  

Just look at that perfect crust in the Half-n-Half Pepperoni & Mushroom / Hawaiian Pizza?  Fuhgeddaboudit...

Great Pizza isn't an easy thing to do...but N.B.Pizza in San Francisco is doing it right.

-- S.Y.B. (nom de plume, btw)
author: Cliff C.

description:
Honestly, this is hard for me to review a pizza place outside of the tri-state area being a native born-and-raised New Yorker, but North Beach does a really great job fulfilling my need for good tasting pizza. 

My favorite is the Super Margherita.
author: Shannon B.

description:
No, no more! I tried to be a loyal customer for more than a decade!

When I first moved to North Beach, I lived 1.5 blocks from this venue.

Even with competition like Tony's raising the bar -- and Golden Boy still serving strong -- this op doesn't either get it or care. 

Stuck in a pinch last night due to the failure of a dish I tried to cook on my own gas range, I ordered a large Hawaiian from North Beach Pizza. 

30 bucks.

I guess it's loyal customers like me on auto-pilot who keeps this joint in business.

Although delivery was quick -- and why shouldn't it be? -- I'm 4 blocks away  . . .

What was delivered was a flacid, greasy, under-cooked slab of shame. North Beach Pizza should thank me for this review, in that I did not photograph -- and post -- what they wrought. 

Perhaps I'm spoiled by the most recent pizza I enjoyed: Avanti! in Menlo Park. Better, cheaper, truly amazing. Easily matches Zoetrope Cafe.

As for we in North Beach, Tony's is the *only* option for take-out. So I invite us all to put up with the lines and wait times at Tony's -- whether on the phone or in person.

As for North Beach Pizza, they deserve to go out of business for the low-quality, careless product that they are serving us. Never again!

They should thank us for the business we've given them.
author: Paul A.

description: This place is beyond terrible. Ordered through door dash and it felt like there was no crust and only cheese. The veggies weren't cooked well and there was barely any sauce. It felt like five day old pizza just heated up with a bunch of extra cheese. Don't bother
author: Ashmita V.

description:
I've done some really stupid things before but this one tops the cake when it comes to dining. 
We had guests from Toronto/Singapore. It was time for lunch on Labor Day. I'm not feeling well, haven't been to work for the past week, but I'm the driver. Talked to my doctor last week. What he suggested isn't really working. Getting worse. Going to call him again tomorrow. 
Let's go to Sotto Mare for lunch. Should have called. They're closed. Hmm. Let's just get pizza from Tony's. Look! There's a parking space right across the street! They open in 10 minutes. Everyone got out. I sat int he van and rested. The doors open, I get out, pay the meter, cross the street. 
We're seated at the table against the front window. I can see the take-out area next door. Was there a door there before? I don't remember. I hope I can sit through this meal. Menus presented. Water and drinks served. We'll order three pizzas. All Medium. We like getting different flavors.
We were there only long enough to chow down on our pies, but where the heck are the crowds? The lines out the door? The people buying slices. Oh well. We've never been here at opening on a holiday before.
Margherita - 4 - this is the one that won for Tony in Naples. Since when did he start putting cold sliced tomatoes on this pie? Well, he did used to do it at Pyzano's in Castro Valley ever so long ago. Crust is okay though not as thin or crackery. It works.
Garlic Chicken - 4 - not something that I would usually order but it's quite flavorful. Same issues with the crust but not a deal breaker.
Coit Tower - 4 - Chosen by the youngster from Canada. He wants his meat pie.
All three were decent. We didn't finish any of them but there wasn't quite enough slices left to make a whole pie. I told the kid that it'd be a great late night snack in his hotel room. His mother and grandmother weren't so sure but they can't argue with their host. 
I hobbled back to the van, my wife put the pizza in the back and we continued on with our tour of San Francisco. At the end of the day, when I handed the kid the box, I was wondering why it had North Beach Pizza on the lid. 
OMG! I told you that I wasn't feeling well. And no one corrected me. We were four blocks from Tony's and at the wrong restaurant. Thank goodness the pizza and service were decent. Sorry Tony. We'll get you next time.
author: Dexter D.

description: This is a great pizza place on the North End.  Tony's is overcrowded and has a long wait so if you want a cool neighborhood place with great service come to this place.  There's a sit down full service side or a by-the-slice side. Good beer and wine.  Decent prices.  A great family stop.  They have big screen TVs with the game on.  Walk one more block and come here.
author: Laura D.

description:
Took a quick trip to Coit Tower today with family. We were starving after walking up and down all the steps! Beautiful day. We were going to go to Golden Boy, but it was packed and we really wanted somewhere to sit. 

We circled back around and stopped in North Beach Pizza. There was no one in there! A little warm when we got in, but appears the server noticed and turned on the air. Nice breeze through the open door. 

We were immediately seated, given nice cold glasses of water, and menus. Best part- absolutely spotless bathrooms! Woo! 

Our pizza came fast and HOT! Basil and garlic were fresh, as were the tomatoes. Seriously one of the best Margherita pizza's I have had. Hands down. 

Great little place to stop, they even had pizza by the slice if you are in a hurry. I'll be back.
author: Rachel N.

description:
Ordered takeout via Yelp since I live a block away. I showed up right on time at 7:49 - which is when the app said my food would be ready. When I got there everything was ready to go. I picked up buffalo wings, fries, and eggplant parm.

Buffalo wings were sub par, the eggplant parm was great, the fries were divine! Thick cut, well seasoned, absolutely delicious. The eggplant parm came with a side of vegetables and pasta with red sauce. 

Overall great value and I'm very satisfied/full after my meal :)
author: Inci A.

description: I love this place. The pizza is amazing and the staff are great. On my last trip I had 5 teenage boys (my nephews) and my teenage daughter. They all wanted different drinks, changed their mind a few times, different side dishes, appetizers, and toppings. The staff were extremely patient with us!! Love them.  One of my nephews felt a little self conscious about his pink feather hat, so privately I asked the waitress if she wouldn't mind complimenting his hat, and she did! Later on one of the other waiters walked over to help pick up plates and also complimented his hat! He was beyond ecstatic.  It was a perfect ending to our SF adventure. Thank you!!!
author: J O.

description:
Been coming here for ever this is place 
Great pie every time 
Service is perfect and it taste the same every time
author: Joe L.

description:
OK place to get a slice while wondering around.

Based on the multitude of awards on the wall I thought it would have been the best pizza you could find but it is just par for the course.  Not great, not bad.  

Price is also average but maybe a little above market.  Given the location that's not surprising. 

I'd go back or maybe I wouldn't.  I suppose I'm about as ambivalent about this place as I can get.
author: Tarek S.

description:
Order for delivery (for dash) 

Pizza was good for not being a pizza eater. Bought pepperoni sausage and mushrooms. $20 pizza for small but worth it. I'll be returning
author: Paris S.

description:
[In tune of The Weeknd - I Feel it Coming]

"I feel like Yelpin, I feel like Yelpin, Babe"
"I feel like Yelpin, I feel like Yelpin, Babe"
"I feel like Yelpin, I feel like Yelpin, Babe"

Oh....so long, Oh so long. Yelping really is a habit, "Get like me!" Although it doesn't seem like I care at times "Yelpdom" I really do. All work and no "North Beach" has made "Mr Gold Chain" a very unhappy guy. The things we put ourselves through sometimes just to make a "Buck" willing and unwillingly sometimes. But, I must say on this day I had to make my return to SF and go to my surrogate home and reclaim some crowns more or less. I also wanted to try something new..it's easy to just only go to places you like "Dip, Golden Boy, Busters ect" for a quick bite but..North Beach Pizza I hadn't been too yet. I wanted to knock this off my bookmarks, my review starts now..

Tuesday June 13, 2017
Location: North Beach Pizza SF, Ca
People: 1 Adult

Story:
North Beach had a bone to pick with me, and I was there to face the music. It felt great to be in "The City" I love being out there, a place where any day you go feels like a Saturday or Sunday. I had been away for what seemed like an eternity, but I was finally able to make my re-debut. As I'm trying to have more things to "Yelp" about. "North Beach Pizza" isn't far from my usual hangouts. With Pizza joints being all around North Beach, I decided to give yet another one a try..

Service/Hospitality:
Pretty standard service, I got greeted when I came in....Yea..Very quick interaction here and I was pretty much on my way from there.

Food/Cleanliness:
North Beach Pizza is more than just a pizza joint, they serve standard Italian Food here (Pasta, Whole Pizza, Sandwinches ect) On this visit for me though, I just went simple and had 2 slices of Pepperoni and Sausage $4.00 (Plus Tax on Single Slices Only) It was decent pizza for the price. The server took the slices I had and ran them through the pizza oven to re-warm them up a bit. I took the slices back to "Grant and Green" to enjoy with a beer. It was tasty, maybe better had it been a super fresh slice. It had a nice topping to cheese ratio for me, the end crust did get a bit chewy I guess from the re-heating but otherwise decent. I took time to examine the place a bit before I left. The place was tidy, a few tables needed to be cleared from what I could see on the restaurant side, but the togo slice area was clean for the most part.

Overall:
North Beach Pizza is another "North Beach" pizza joint I can cross off my list. I think once I finally try "Tony's Pizza" I will have to do a ranking of my favorite pizza spots in "Little Italy" I liked this place and would recommend it forsure for a quick slice, but for the uniqueness....I would still choose "Golden Boy Pizza" over this place. So on that note I leave you with this....

So now "Yelpdom", with an open heart and an empty stomach, I say unto you in the words of my uncle: "Allez Cuisine!"
author: Tre S.

description: Open late. Awful pizza. Soggy asf. DiGiornio is better, but our options at the time were limited.
author: Tom G.

description:
*~A drunk late night pizza review~*

Drunkenly strolling around North Beach looking for Golden Boy Pizza with my friends stumbled upon this place. Half of us decided to order from here for convenience sake (hungry, no line, pizza looked good) and the other half (me) decided to continue the search for Golden Boy.

We found Golden Boy and behold, the line was around the block. After 3 rounds of rock paper scissors, we decided to skip the line and go to North Beach Pizza. There weren't many pizza options but the cook in the back seemed pretty busy in creating a variety of pizzas. At the time, they had Hawaiian, pepperoni, cheese, mushroom pesto, sausage pesto. I ordered the mushroom pesto because my friend gave me a hard time about how pigs are as smart as dogs- how dare you order the sausage. I'm okay with that, I do love mushrooms. 

The pizza was pretty good. The crust- soft, warm, thick---- not the thick as in "this is too chewy I'm going to choke", it was a good thick. I'm not the biggest pesto fan so I was glad it wasn't smothered in pesto sauce- just enough for the kick. What was noticeable was the cheese! A very cheesy pizza- not hating, I LOVE cheese. And perfectly sautéed mushrooms. My drunken stomach was more than pleased with this pizza. 

Is it at good as Golden Boy... debatable. But when it's 1230am and the Golden Boy line is obnoxious- this place is a great alternative. Because we all just want pizza when we had a few drinks right?!
author: Marcie A.

description:
We really enjoyed it! 

We ordered: 
North Beach Pizza
Ravioli with meat sauce
Caprese salad
Alfredo

Pizza was really good. Good crispy crust.  The ravioli was yummy and the sauce was fantastic!  The salad was okay. I would have preferred a more traditional service instead of a mound of salad adorned with cheese, tomatoes, and pesto. The Alfredo was good but lacked seasoning. Easily solved with a bit of salt. 

Overall I would still recommend North Beach Pizza. The service was quick and pleasant and the food was, overall, good.
author: Krissy W.

description:
Great lunch stop after visiting Coit tower!

Really good pizza, nice people, and perfect for bigger groups.
author: T.J. M.

description: I have always loved this pizza since working in SF. I remember when I first got it back in 2016, when I used to work at Starbucks. I recently ordered the North Beach special on Friday 8/25 and Cable Car Special 8/26. Although the hot wings were super spicy but I loved them. The pizza was fresh, hot and most of delicious. You can't never get enough of North Beach Pizza. It is a SF STAPLE OF PIZZA. Anytime when I'm in SF or at work, this pizza place is the first on my list. Definitely recommend and worth it too.
author: Jaiesha C.

description: Sure has gone downhill since my last visit a few years ago. Had a large North Beach pizza that was pretty sparse on toppings for $30. I think a $9.99 Costco combo pizza would have been more satisfying
author: gene f.

description: OK so I've never been a big fan of writing reviews but this one definitely deserves it. I've lived in San Francisco for six years and I've gone to North Beach pizza before and it's been good but this last time I went about a week ago it was a completely different experience. I can say I have had the best experience at a restaurant last week when I walked in to this restaurant.I was attended by this girl I believe her name was Bianka but she's the one with the short hair she was the best host I could have ever had I have nothing but good things to say about her. But all I could say is thank you.
author: Marcos F.

description: I came here for lunch one time and got spaghetti. It was a good-sized portion and tasted really good! I haven't tried their pizza, but I'd come back to try it, or even just to get pasta again! Friendly waiters too!
author: Marie D.

description:
Easy to get a table. Food took some time to arrive, but tasted great when it arrived. My food burnt me because it was so hot when it arrived. VERY REASONABLY PRICED. I went for dinner with my family of 4. Service was good.
(The picture is of the penne con formaggi)
author: Maile W.

description:
I have had pizza here several times over the last 25 years. This trip was disappointing. The italian chopped salad was missing ingredients that were listed on the menu and nothing was chopped. It was a weird salad.
The pizza was mediocre and took a really long time to be served.  
Sorry, I don't think I'll be back. Disappointing.
author: Jamie Y.

description:
I stop by this place about every month and they never cease to amaze me with their skill of crafting some of the best pizza i've had in my life, and believe me, I eat a crapload of pizza. 

They always deliver on time and they're friendly as well. 

By far my favorite place to grab a fresh slice in the city.
author: Simon D.

description:
Here are the details of what I experienced:

- 6pm: put in an order for delivery to a South Beach address ( less than 3 miles away)
-Told to expect delivery at 7:04
-Called at 7:17 and was told that it was almost there.
-Called at ~758 and was told that its probably ten minutes out
-Delivered at ~813 
-Warmed up a lukewarm pizza
-It tasted great.

They were totally unapologetic throughout. 

That was my experience, take it for what you will.
author: John C.

description:
Back in 2014, someone recommended that I try this place, but not the other location.  I'm fairly particular about pizza, having worked in a good place across the country many, many years ago.

Today, everything seemed to be in sync.  Actually, we had virtually passed the place while heading from Coit Tower to Ghiardelli Square and returned.  I swear that I could live every day in San Fran and I still would be lost every day.  Yeesh!

In any case, coming around from the park, it was fairly easy to see this on the corner.  The interior seems both antique and trendy.  The staff was friendly.  Further from the corner, they have a section for those who want slices.  They made sure up front that we knew this.

The waiter arrived with a two glasses of water and took our order for a 12 inch North Beach Combo pizza.  It's your basic deluxe/supreme/whatever you call it.  My buddy remembered after a bit to get a Dr. Pepper and an iced tea.

I'm not sure how long it took for the pizza but after all of the walking, we were okay just to sit.

When the pizza arrived, the woman put it on the table with a pedestal and two spatulas.  It looked quite colorful.  As we took a slice, the cheese was very stringy, and we had to catch ingredients.

Taking a bite, the crust seemed manufactured.  Good, but the texture suggested that a machine had prepared it.  I suppose this is a thing nowadays.  We had also been to a place called Red Robin Pizza in Livermore with similar methods.

The pizza was quite good, and the price was reasonable at $18.50.  That's less than Mountain Mike's and quite a lot less than Round Table, but of course, you're not getting linguiça and a few other items.  It was more enjoyable than their pizzas.

Returning would matter on being in the neighborhood.  I really wouldn't walk all over the place to go there but if it was conveniently close, it would be a safe choice.
author: Nobuyuki S.

description:
In the mood for a quick slice of pizza and remembered this spot while walking home. They didn't have many options when I was there. It was pepperoni, ham and pineapple, cheese and a pesto one I think? 

I went with two pepperoni slices and one ham and pineapple. Total came out to $12. Pizza slices didn't look appetizing from the start, regret already setting in. Took the first bite and everything was confirmed...I made a mistake. It was extremely salty and the cheese had a weird texture to it. I can't really put my finger on why it was weird but it just wasn't normal. 

What made it worse is the fact that I live literally 40 steps away from golden boys pizza and three slices from
Golden boys would've been cheaper than the $12 I paid here. I'm never doing that again. 

Would I be back? No way man
author: Michael T.

description:
I don't know if I just caught them on a bad night or just ordered the wrong things, but almost everything I ordered had too much garlic to enjoy. I love garlic, but my meal had enough to stop vampires and humans dead in their tracks. I was exuding garlic thru my skin for the next 2 days.

My favorite part of the meal was the plain spaghetti marinara side and the steamed vegetables. It was the only garlic reprieve in the whole meal.

I will try this place one more time, just in case I happened to unknowingly catch a freak event like national garlic day without knowing it.
author: David T.

description:
Been here twice now because golden boy and Tony's were too busy. The first time I went in, the chicken on the pizza was dry, cracking, and tasted old. 

The second time, they over charged me and gave me a hard time for wanting my money back instead of getting something else on the menu. It wasn't my mistake, it was yours. Then you give me a hard time for a mistake you made. 

Mediocre food and bad service, not coming back.
author: Richard N.

description: Had a piece of course hair (beard or pube) in our food and has ruined it for me and my girlfriend and waiting to get our money back soon. That's disgusting.
author: Ish I.

description:
North Beach pizza is one of my favorites in SF. It's a great family friendly pizzeria. The crust is a bit thicker, but really soft and chewy. 

http://pizzaofsanfrancisco.com/2018/04/09/north-beach-pizza/
author: Lee S.

description: I arrived at North Beach Pizza at 4:00P.M on March 25, 2018. I requested the Salmon, a Greek Salad and a glass of Sauvignon Blanc. Salmon was cooked to perfection, salad was deliciously fresh, and the wine was refreshing. No wait so we were seated right away. It was very clean, even the windows were shiny. Server was friendly and attentive. Timing between salad and main entree was excellent. My overall experience was very good and I would definitely recommended North Beach Pizza to all of my friends. I'll be returning soon.
author: Nancy L.

description: The pizza was amazing. But when we walked in the staff werent polite. They rushed us and looked unfriendly. But fast service.
author: Trisha G.

description: Great food! The pizza, salad, bread sticks, and the spaghetti can't beat it. Great little pizzeria. I will come back to this place when I come back to Frisco!
author: Octavio C.

description: Pros: Best darn pizza in the City. Chewy dough, amazing ingredients! Awesome service! Been a customer since 1997
author: Andrea M.

description:
Good spot for a beer and a slice.
Specifically their slices counter, did not spend any time in the sit down part of the restaurant.

NB has a few slice destinations, but on the day we stopped NBP had no line, and we got our food in record time.
author: Oleg H.

description: Myself and the other officers decided to have pizza in The North Beach District. We decided to go to North Beach Pizza. This place has been in North Beach for a long time. I have been going to this pizzeria since I was a kid. For lunch, I ordered a large sausage, mushroom, and anchovies pizza. The crust was crunch and the ingredients were delicious but the middle of the pizza was watery. Maybe the pizza was too hot because it just came out of the oven. Overall, a great lunch!
author: Larry W.

description: I walked in about 10ish and one of the guys working immediately yelled at me saying "no dine in go next door!!". Completely messed up my appetite because of how rude he said it to me. Terrible customer service in my opinion.
author: Ellie G.

description: So sorry to leave this review.  I really wanted to like their pizza.  Seriously the WORST PIZZA I HAVE EVER HAD.  REPEAT EVER HAD.  It was a piece of flat crappy bread with horrible cheese on top.  I had to use magnifying glasses to see any kind of sauce at all.  WTF??  North Beach Italian food icon area of the world?  A true embarrassment for the city I live in.  Get your act together!  You see any SAUCE on this?  NO!!
author: Lynne P.

description: This place is an institution in the local area of North Beach. I went there on a Monday night with a friend and the place was practically empty. The pizza was just fine and the staff was prompt. The pizza is absolutely fine and it's about the right price for the San Francisco area. But there's nothing about it that particularly stands out either. It's perfectly fine but I would classify it as an average pizza in San Francisco. Perfect place for a family to visit and have a good time and get away from the hustle of Columbus or Broadway Streets. But don't expect a slice of pie that will change your life.
author: Robert C.

description:
I've been going to North Beach Pizza for many, many years, but this was my first visit to the spot across the street from the old joint (yeah, it's been a while since I was last there.)

Newsflash: Holiday Season 2015, annual family journey to SF...

I always try to end my day-long traipse through SF with some really good pizza and this year was no different.

Unfortunately, there are few restaurants open at 2 PM on a Tuesday afternoon (many closed and a few completely shutdown between Christmas and New Years - good for them, much respect.)

So, just being open was a plus, and NBP was one of the few places open.

The "new" restaurant is nice (even though I loved the funky spot across the street!)

Service was really good - given there was only ONE waitress working her ass off between tables in a pretty full restaurant.

Greek salad - quite nice.  Four pizzas - good, perfect for our hungry crowd, but not great/amazing as NBP produced years ago.

I'll even boldly say this...NBP barely holds up to my local pizza joint in San Ramon (and SR is a vast wasteland of mediocre food.)

Bottom line: I liked NBP well enough, but wouldn't return if other spots nearby were open.  Not as good as it used to be...

3 stars - really kinda dissapointed.
author: Patrick L.

description: The worst customer service I ordered to go and my card number was printed in the recipe. Not good and I've been a customer for a long time . But no longer . And the food is pretty good but doing sneaky business . What a shame and do u think they cared about losing a paying customer. Not at all they did not care . Guess I'll have Chinese food tonite . And folk be careful out there with north beach pizza
author: jeff b.

description: Not in the same location that I remember but the pizza was very good.  Got 1/2 clam and the other 1/2 pepperoni and black olive.  The clam half was the bigger hit of the pie.  Don't bother with the salad.  While they have a decent amount and variety of veggies on the plate, it's the same old crappy restaurant service salad dressing that many places serve.  My tip to the owner --- Make a total kick-ass salad dressing from scratch and when someone orders a salad you can say 'do you want the ass kicking dressing we make or the industrial crap'.  You will not only save money but your customers will love you for it.
author: Dick R.

description: This is the BEST Italian restaurant I've ever been to in San Francisco's AND it is INCREDIBLY priced!!! Seriously disturbed that it only had 3 stars on yelp. This place is a great find! From great service to great food, my cup runneth over in overall customer service. We will be back
author: Jenni W.

description: Ordered 8 pizzas on a busy Mothers' Day, estimated delivery was 60-70 minutes. It got there in less than 30! You guys rock!
author: Tony C.

description: They're the best in SF!  They're consistently great, for years, and years! Can't miss with these guys. They've got a nice menu and I really like their lasagna as well. You can count on them to come through for you.
author: Louisa V.

description:
They have excellent quality-price pizza and friendly delivery AND they were open past 11PM in an area where everyone else had closed! Keep the outstanding service and food experience North Beach Pizza!
Bruno
author: Bruno A.

description: Best Italian food I've had in a long time and this is coming from someone who has been to Italy!Absolutely delicious food for a very reasonable price. I would definitely come back again :)!
author: Esther M.

description: I went here after wanting to eat pizza at Tony's Pizza. At North Beach Pizza, we were promptly and cheerfully greeted by the host. We were seated with a smile. Our food was yummy and we all were happy. We will definitely be back to enjoy the great food and service here.
author: Marshall M.

description:
North Beach pizza has been one of SF's go to pizza places- grant for office use, sunset, and San Mateo. 

Faves are SF, north beach, and coit. All sites have been consistent with their pizzas. Last order was on Mar 2017 from grant. 

Happy pizza eating.
author: Richard C.

description:
We ordered the same thing as last time, spaghetti bolognese and gnocchi.

Gnocchi was okay but not consistent with our last experience. The pasta did not taste fresh and was hard.

When we ate the spaghetti we got a really bad stomach ache right away afterwards. I'm pretty sure it was prepared unproperly because I tried eating it again later and got a stomach ache again.
author: Joy M.

description:
Remember when NB Pizza was really good?
I sure do.
I used to get a pie here every weekend.  1/2 North Beach, 1/2 Coit Tower.
Those were the days...

I'm sorry to say that, today, it's just a thin crust of what it once was.

Now, even back in the day when people flocked here, you still had to ask for light cheese.  Otherwise, they would pile that dairy on like there was no tomorrow.  

That I can live with.

Toppings that are dry & flavorless, w a cardboard crust, are things I cannot.

Being able to order until 2am (or later some nights) has sustained them for a very long time.  

Plus the fact that they deliver that late too...well, that's a huge plus in life.

Sometimes life gives you stuff & you might need a pizza delivered after midnight.  Or 2:00am.  

And you don't want that pizza to be from Mr. Pizza Man.  Trust me.  

But now, w the Great Pizza Renaissance this town is in, & all the competition that brings, I can no longer just default to NB Pizza.  

The times have a changed.

In a pinch, or just to fill your belly, I can see it.

Otherwise?  Pass.

Still, better than Mr. Pizza Man.

2 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description:
I didn't know that so many things could go wrong with an order as simple as a pizza and hot wings... Guess I was wrong.

I called in my order at 7:44 on a Wednesday night, and was told I would receive my order within 45-60 minutes. For those keeping track, that would have 8:45 on the long side. My order arrived at 9:10, which is almost 1 1/2 hours. But I didn't complain, and I still tipped the delivery guy, because hey, it's not his fault, right? Well, it turns out that the pizza must have left the store some time before it's arrival to my door, because it was cold, and so were the hot wings.

I proceeded to eat the pizza, only to find that the crust was not cooked all the way through, and was still gloppy and raw in the middle. I had to peel back the cheese and toppings, and then remove the uncooked parts of dough, so I could finish my slice. So after that fiasco, I proceeded to dig into the hot wings... only to find that they were barely cooked also! I couldn't believe it. You know how raw chicken skin is pale, white, flabby and chewy? That's what every single wing was like. I just couldn't believe it. But I had been traveling all day to return home to SF, and I was starving, so I made the best of a bit more pizza and put the rest, along with the wings, in the fridge and cooked them all the next day. 

So for the privilege of having the ingredients delivered to me so that I could properly cook everything myself, I paid $42.36.

Oh, and to top it all off... I tipped the driver $4.00, but my credit card statement says I was charged $4.82 -- so even after all of that, the driver padded his tip fraudulently!!! 
I was disappointed that the food was terrible, but I am so furious that someone would take the liberty of changing their tip (no matter how small) - especially considering what an awful experience it was. 

I am done with this place.
author: Jean O.

description:
GREAT DELIVERY SERVICE! I was attracted to the $10 delivery minimum... Food got here in under an hour and it was still hot. I ordered the eggplant parmagiana and meat toasted ravioli which they gave me in a cake box... Interesting but when I opened the box everything was nice packaged. They even gave me napkins, fork and knife, crushed red peppers and Parmesan cheese, and 3 slices of French bread with butter. VERY impressed with the level of effort.
The food itself was amazing. I'm used to my toasted ravioli being served with marinara sauce but the one they gave me was even better because it had nice herbs in it. The eggplant parmagiana was a huge portion. 2 large slices of eggplant and generous helping of spaghetti with some vegetables.
Very impressed and I'll definitely order from here again :)
author: Bianca M.

description: Pizza is signature dish for a reason. Veggie with pesto was my favorite, but cable car was a close second. Fettuccini carbonara was delicious and had plenty of pancetta.  Nice family atmosphere and attentive service.
author: L S.

description:
Tried this place on Eat24. 
Ordered 2 salads for pick up to bring back to work.  The description of the first one was a chopped salad with chicken, pancetta, artichoke, cece beans, red onions, Gorgonzola cheese on mixed greens.  Well, there was no red onion or artichoke at all.  The chicken was abundant, and greens were very fresh.  The salad was very filling.  

The second one was a Greek salad. Also abundant in flavor.  

I will give these guys another chance.  Maybe they were out of onions and artichokes?  Who knows?
author: Scott A.

description:
We stopped in here for two slices of pepperoni pizza really just slightly better than Pizza Hut and paid $10. The pizza was greasy and the cheese was completely tasteless. When we came in the place was completely empty. I wonder why? 

Save your money...
author: Zoe R.

description: We had the pizza delivered. It was cold and completely undercooked. The dough in the center was almost raw and stuck to the paper underneath. After I baked it for a good 10 minutes it was pretty good. When I pay $25 for a pizza, however, it's not unreasonable to expect it to arrive fully cooked. It had been quite a while since we had ordered pizza from here and it will be quite a while until we order again--if ever. Lots of other choices in this town.
author: Michele N.

description:
1.5 stars.  So we were relaxing in our hotel room one weekday evening when my boyfriend and I were a bit hungry.  Our hotel's restaurant surprsingly doesn't have room service for lunch & dinner (only breakfast), so this is the restaurant they partner with to order food and have delivered.  

The menu says, "Fast Delivery", yet the arrival of the delivery took an hour and 15 minutes, which is what they said up front when we ordered.  

I had dozed off and by the time the food came, I honestly wasn't hungry anymore.  We ordered a chicken salad and meatball sub.  The chicken in the salad seemed like some hard, 2-day old chunks and the sub sandwich was edible, but that 's about it.

The delivery guy was nice though!
author: Rolena I.

description: This food was excellent, don't get me wrong, but the service was absolutely terrible. The waiter had no manners whatsoever.
author: Eleanor T.

description: Four enthusiastic stars for North Beach Pizza.  I've been coming here for 25 years and I wish that everyone knew how to make pizza like North Beach.  There's nothing in Calgary that even comes close. The wine list is a bit skimpy and the place should be busier but the quality of the pizza is second to none.  Highly recommend.
author: Jeff F.

description: Love their Veggie Pizza. Small Pizza is a good size for the price. Have had in service dining as well as delivery and everyone has always been very friendly. I do wish they had outlets for chargers.
author: Lauryn H.

description:
One of my good friends introduced me to North Beach Pizza as we were walking to his apartment from downtown to Telegraph Hill.  It's a regular stop on his foot commute to work, so he's gotten to know this place and its staff well.  It turns out North Beach Pizza has two locations in San Francisco and one down in San Mateo.  This location, at the corner of Union and Grant, is the original.

The pizzas are made with whole milk mozzarella cheese and the dough is hand-spun.  There are about a dozen house special pizzas, many named with a local flair.  For example, there's the Coit Tower Special (mushrooms, sausage, salami, pepperoni) and the Golden Gate Special (chicken, pesto, mushrooms, garlic, and onions).  Pizzas come in three sizes (12", 14", 16") and start at about $10 for a small with no toppings.  House specials range from about $12-27 depending on size and toppings.  Pizza by the slice is also available and costs $4 per slice.

While pizza is the specialty, North Beach Pizza also serves other Italian cuisine such as pasta (spaghetti, fettuccine, tortellini, ravioli, lasagna), entrees like parmigiana, Italian sandwiches (e.g. meatball), and soups and salads.  Pasta and entrees are typically around $12 and sandwiches are $7-8.

I recommend the following pizzas:

North Beach Special - pepperoni, green bell pepper, sausage, mushroom, onion, black olives
Cable Car Special - garlic sauce, chicken, bacon, green onion, tomatoes

Whether it's by the slice or ordered whole, the pizzas are delicious.  We're talking borderline five stars here.  The by-the-slice pizzas are premade and sitting behind glass display cases next to the ordering counter.  They're available for immediate consumption.  Thus, this place is ideal if you're on-the-go.  Sit-down is fine too.

You can tell the toppings are fresh.  I like the North Beach Special because of its large and savory pepperoni slices and hints of garlic.  I like the Cable Car Special because garlic sauce is used instead of tomato sauce.  The garlic sauce is creamy and full of flavor.  No matter which pizza you order, the crust is amazing.  Crispy on the outside, soft and delightfully chewy on the inside.  I want to say the dough also has some extra flavor added in.  Garlic, perhaps?

Service is excellent.

Simply put, North Beach Pizza makes some very tasty pizzas.
author: Daniel B.

description: This place is trash. I would never go back or recommend it... we came here because the original place we were headed to had a 40 min wait. So we crossed the street and ended here instead BIG MISTAKE! The food and service were awful
author: Cathy J.

description:
This place has declined quite a bit.  As other reviewers have said you used to have to ask for light cheese, now it's included.  A pizza from here should not be orange especially since it's $28 for a large.  I've seen more cheese on a Little Caesars pizza.

Really really disappointing.
author: Chris C.

description: We enjoyed our pizza... Absolutely delicious! I would go back here again!! The waitstaff was pretty attentive as well! The Cable Car & pepperoni was very yummy!!
author: KT S.

description: 3 stars because the restaurant had a nasty moldy smell to it. Like someone mopped the floors with dirty water. Our waiter wasn't the friendliest but got us our food. We ordered the garlic cheese pizza and margarita pizza. The cheese pizza was very cheesy and good. The margarita pizza was also great and the sauce was very light. The pizzas are thin crust.
author: Sarah F.

description:
They finally opened up a bigger layout for more dining availability compared to the former one across the street from this place, which was dim and super small for dining in!

This layout is much more modern, clean, with brighter lighting and just overall much better than the other location.

I love the smell of their pizzas!  The aroma captivates my attention every time I walk by this restaurant!

Their other dishes, such as the Chicken Marsala and Caesar Salad isn't bad!  I enjoyed their Chicken Marsala very much!  A little bit on the salty side, but the entree had mushrooms that were marinated in cooked, white wine taste that I really like!  The combination of the sauce they used with the white wine, complimented the mushrooms and chicken splendidly well!  YUM!

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/AdGVHby-rwevZ0kzUmmwUg?select=F7uLhI5HTMJ5yPHY-Be5cw#EjHYCb53gX_XXNemPkXL9Q

They used a lot of dressing for the Caesar Salad, but I did like the cheesiness and the crunchiness of the croutons. 

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/AdGVHby-rwevZ0kzUmmwUg?userid=I-FmdvI28N7OIIt4JZOgIg#sGJ12J8jjYKGr74FqwAclg

If you're feeling lazy to go out to get tasty pizza, this place delivers!
author: Tiffany D.

description: I'm a regular at their Berkeley location and absolutely love it, so I figured that the original establishment would be even better, but after dining in one evening; I have to say I wasn't impressed. The food was good, but the service was absolutely awful, the workers weren't very friendly and they took forever to return to our table to check if we needed anything, and twice I had walk over to the counter to get service. Like I mentioned above, the food was good, but that just isn't enough for me to want to return, I'll stick with Berkeley.
author: Joseph A.

description:
This is the first time I have order a salad from this place. We'll let me tell you, it is nasty!
The chicken salad is gross!
You guys definitely do not use fresh chicken  breast, and seriously I have no idea what you use instead. 
It is all watery,  fake and processed chicken.

I can't believe they will serve such a thing!

Seriously! I will never order from you guys!
author: Rossi C.

description: Full house n 1 waitress, I think that says it all about how slow and whack this service is. The pizza was ok nothing great.
author: Eli C.

description:
I have ordered from NB grant street often. Tonight, for the first time, I gave a credit card number. I called at 8:11pm and was told the usual 45mins. At 9:16pm I started calling to see if something had gone wrong. The phone was busy, although I called constantly - over 148 times, in fact - NEVER reaching a person. 
In sure it was a busy night, but right up until closing? When they KNEW an order had gone astray? AND they had my telephone number (not to mention the credit card).
I will call them back tomorrow. 
UPDATE:  I called I the following day - Tuesday -  and found out they had copied my phone number wrong; when I called for my free pizza today -  Thursday - I was told they don't have that policy. As I was trying to explain the man hung up on me; I called back - same man said you have to call the following day. I did that. He refused to hear me out.
author: Don Y.

description: Middling to mediocre. Pizza Hut is probably better. $4 per slice and it completely lacks flavor. Even after a night of going out and craving pizza, this was disappointing. I'm not going to say I didn't eat it, but I regretted it even while I was doing it.
author: Nick M.

description:
Food 5- stars! 
We had the cheese ravioli in pesto sauce and the chicken parmesan sandwich. Both were really, really good and we took half of it home, portions were just too big. 

Only 4- stars in total because of the appearance. The place itself is cute, has enough tables and a separate area for take outs and pizza by slice. Restrooms are way cleaner than expected. 
However it looked a little cluddered, maybe it was just really busy before we got there but free tables were still dirrty and full of dishes. 

And i am so sorry to say that because our waitress was super nice but the staff was the first reason why I doubted the quality of this place. 
Like I said, it turned out that she was really friendly and we didnt have to wait long for food and drinks. However the staff really has to work on their grooming standards. Ripped pants, dirty nails, nail polish crumbeled off. Just doesn't work for me at all, sorry.
author: Caroline K.

description:
I have been to this pizza place on 3 separate occasions. The first time was fine. The second time they forgot my pizza and after I reminded them, brought it without any deduction from the bill. The night of Santacon we decided to go back since we had a large group and there was not a long wait. Worst mistake.
1. There was a piece of hair in our breadsticks
2. They forgot ANOTHER pizza
3. There was ANOTHER piece of hair in one of the pizzas

We told the waitress and since she was the only one working, we were not attended to at first. Finally, the manager comes over and only offered a discount off the bill instead of completely removing the pizza and breadsticks that contained that hair.

Have not been back since and would recommend going a block down to Tony's or a different, much cleaner and better pizza joint which are scattered all across North Beach.
author: Shelby L.

description: This pizza was on point! We went per recommendation of a local San Franciscan and it passed our expectations. The calamari was crispy and delicious. We ordered a pizza called the special and also a classic pepperoni. Crust was soft, but crispy and basically perfect all over. Just the right amount of topping , cheese and sauce. We loved it so much. If we come back, we will make sure to visit it again.
author: Melissa J.

description:
Ok it's really 4,5 stars ... but it sure as hell is not 3 stars.

I'm talking Margarita Pizza done right!
Thin crispy crust, stretchy cheese, fresh basil & tomatoes. 

Just the way I like it. 

We'll done!!!
author: William L.

description: My favorite pizza in North Beach! Consistently good whether you go in for just a slice or get a whole pizza. Good prices as well (slice of pepperoni is $4!!!). Only downside is sometimes they are closed when they say they are open (either on Yelp or their open sign is on).
author: Julia M.

description: I don't have pizza often, but when I do, this is my north beach go-to. The north beach pizza is consistently good. Service is always pretty good.
author: Kelly S.

description:
We got  1/2 North Beach Pizza Special and a  1/2 Verdi Special. My hubby liked the quality toppings of the North Beach Pizza, but he complained about the soggy middle. I loved the Verdi special with the pesto, spinach, onions, and feta sauce. The flavors were delicious, as compared with the pesto pizza at Golden Boy. The bottom of the pizza was crispy. I love the dough for the crust. Nom nom.  

The small pizza was a bit expensive for $17, but at least it was good.
author: Jackie S.

description:
Reviews didn't look super great here, and I almost talked my buddies out of ordering from here. But they swore by it, and said it was the best pizza around. 

We were hanging out in fisherman;s wharf at the studio, and of course we were hungry, cause we just wrapped up playing rummy and egyptian rat-screw.... Yeah, it had been years since I had played it, but I've still got it, and I won : ) 

Anyhow, we're starving, and wanted pizza delivered. We ordered 2 mediums, a combo and pepperoni. There were 5 of us, and no one was starving, but we definitely wanted food. Delivery was pretty fast, the price was reasonable. And the food? Well, for a thin crusted pizza, (which I am a fan of) I liked it, quality ingredients and the crust was right.

We had about 1/2 of 1 pizza left over. I had some of that 3 or 4 days later, and it was still good! Usually pizza that old isn't great, but in the microwave for a minute, this came out surprisingly good. The crust wasn't all soggy or anything. 

I'd order from here again. Maybe a 5th star after I check out the venue, but for delivery, I can't give more than 4.
author: Benny N.

description: So disappointed.  I have been coming here for over 20 years and noticed the last few times it wasn't the same.  The Pizza was always amazing. Thick delicious crust with tons of toppings and cheese.  Now it's just thin crust with barely any toppings.  I only get to come here once or twice a year so I asked the waitress if there were new owners.  She hesitated and said yes.  Wow they have ruined a historic Pizzeria. I also noticed that in the past, no matter what time of day it was packed and super busy.  The last two times....empty.  Super sad.
author: Kim M.

description:
I like the Verdi Pizza here.  It is a long time favorite and it has been awhile. 

I ordered "online."  I put that in quotes because I was charged $1.00 for the convenience of  ordering "online" but then they call you, and basically have you give payment information and confirm your order over the phone.  Pretty dark ages if you ask me. 

Pizza was ok.  Delivery time was within reason.  Driver didn't have peppers or parmesan to give me with the pizza which was ridiculous.  I ordered a side of ranch which was placed in the box with the pizza and got all gross and hot and ruined once it came to me. 

Not going to order again.
author: Katharine A.

description: Pizza was almost an hour late and for an apology I got two cans of coke which were warmer than the pizza.
author: Steve L.

description: this pizza sucks, but the wings are even worse. do not oder this dog food, it totally sucks
author: Jeff M.

description: Been eating here 30 years, I did like the old, funky location better. The pizza used to be better also, and most of all, cheaper! 2 small pizzas + 2 drinks is $45. The pizza is still pretty good, thin crust, wide selection of toppings (chicken with pesto), but somehow not the same.
author: Peter C.

description: The pizza tasted like it was sitting for over 30 minutes until it got delivered. I waited over an hour and 10 mins. The driver didn't even deliver to my front door. He said wasn't able to leave his car..HELLO you are suppose to deliver to my door not me come outside to get it and of course I did not give a tip. The cheesecake was small sliced and looked like it was moving around in the clear container, very messy. The fried zucchini was very soggy and had no taste to it all, I would NEVER order from this place again. I'm very disappointed with the food!!!!
author: Wena D.

description:
This is for the San Mateo location on 3rd. Not the one in the city.

The manager, white bald guy 40s told his subordinate to not let me into the bathroom. Then upon finding out we were paying customers the white guy approaches and says sorry to my white friend and not to me. later it is explained that a bunch of Asians had come in looking for the bathroom so that's why they denied me access and then apologized to the white person.

I'm older and would've let this slide but it really is wrong. If you are and white and particularly Asian do not use this business. They actively discriminate.
author: No N.

description: Ordered delivery. Took some time but person was polite. Ordered two pizzas. Big pizzas. More than we could eat. Taste was ok. Thin crust was more of a pan style. Got their tower pizza. Was decent. Average pizza at a fair price.
author: Keith B.

description:
I ordered the Coit Tower pizza while in town visiting and was very impressed! The pizza had great flavor and was delivered in 45 minutes (for free!).

At $20 for a small (incl. tax) it's certainly not the cheapest pizza, but the taste was great and I would order again.
author: Todd P.

description:
This is my least favorite North Beach Pizza location. 

It was a Saturday night and it took my bf and I an hour to find parking, so needless to say, we already weren't happy campers by the time we were seated.

The ambiance of this location is pretty nice. It wasn't too packed when we came in. We were seated fairly quickly and given the menu and our waitress came to take our order 15 minutes later. We settled on garlic bread for an appetizer, he had the tortellini carbonara, and I settled on the eggplant parm. 

The garlic bread was ok, nothing to rave about. My bf was disappointed with his entree because there was literally no ham to be found on his plate and the description clearly said "cream sauce with ham." Big fail! My eggplant parm wasn't extraordinary either. I've had better delivery from the Taraval location.

Our waitress was by herself at the time, but that shouldn't excuse her lack of customer service. There were only 3 other tables besides ours and she failed to refill our water and it took her forever to give us our check. The bill came out to around $30 and we still had the decency to tip. 

Definitely go somewhere else if you're looking for better service and food. I have nothing bad to say about their pizza because I've had it several times and I like it, just skip the pasta if you want to dine here.
author: Fallon P.

description:
If you know how to SPELL pizza, you need to go here. Seriously! I have been going here for 15 years; nothing beats it. 

Pros:
**The best pizza in Bay Area
**Fast service
**Over flow shop a few steps down the street; if you dont want to wait
**Hang with my Italian bodies after dinner

Cons: 
**usually there is a wait due to its popularity
**Gets noisy at times
author: Max L.

description:
This is one of the best pizzerias in the bay area. Whenever we have an office party at work, we ALWAYS order from here & everyone loves the pizza! Their pizza is always tasty, good pizza crust, fresh ingredients, and good service. 

Recommendations: Verde, Coit Tower, and North Beach Special.
author: Jennifer J.

description:
I came here when I was 10 years old when it was still at its old spot across the street and it was amazing!!! Fast forwards 10 years and it's a flipping disgrace to what it used to be. 

No flavor, tasteless, horrible. Might as well eat a frozen pizza.

Pretty sure it was sold to new owners who are too cheap to have more than one waitress on at all times. That says a lot about them. It's not hard to see that they could care less about the quality of the pizza. They just want to make money off of what it used to be. 

Sad. Just sad.
author: Edson M.

description:
Ok for some reason it's not cool to say your favorite pizza in SF is North Beach if you live in SF.  You have to say Tony's, Golden Boy, Za, blah blah blah.

You know what?  I love this pizza, and their service is awesome.  Friday night at 11pm?  No problem, 45 minutes means 45 minutes or even less.  Sunday during a big game?  Got you covered.  They don't have overpriced limited supply margarita made with the Buratta imported form somewhere you've never heard of, but they do have kick ass pizza.
author: Matt P.

description: If you want great pizza made fresh this place is a must. We had the North Beach Special and it didn't disappoint. Great place to sit in the window with a glass of wine and enjoy great pizza.
author: Bernard O.

description:
We were staying at a hotel in downtown San Francisco, and they were kind enough to deliver.

Service was great.  They came right to the door.

However, the pizza came to us with the toppings on one side but not the other and the crust was too hard for my liking.  

No pizza is bad pizza, so we liked it, but it was a tad expensive.  There might be better options in the city.
author: Jim D.

description: Pizza's great, service sucks. But it always has and probably always will. I keep coming back cause it's great pizza though. Tiny place, overpacked, dirty tables, understaffed. Waiter forgot my salad this last time we visited but he didn't charge us for it so it's OK. There is no hostess of any kind so there's no real order to the place. If they were to get some more waiters and a hostess this place would rock. But keep making the pizza the way you do cause it's some of the best in North Beach!
author: Dusty N.

description:
Have been going here for years with no issues but last night 5/18 was different story.
I ordered the Verdi piazza with sausage. Sausage was burned black and it ruined the pizza. Where's the quality control? For a $25.00 including tip pizza.. wow...
Here's a photo of the burnt pizza toppings.
author: Keef Y.

description:
Pizza in California sucks. Everywhere. All the time. Donatos is my favorite pizza. This place came highly recommended and per the usual... It was just pizza. Lazy. Boring. Same old pizza. 

We walked past at least 15 restaurants packed with people... And got here and we were the only people in the place. 

We ordered a small cheese pizza,?coronas, and fried zucchini. 

Zucchini - small fry like pieces fried in a heavy batter. Pretty good if u like batter more than zucchini. Wasn't what I am used to but it was ok. 

Coronas came with lemons.... 

Pizza was what I've come to expect everywhere in California. Mostly bread. Cheese in the middle and then gets lighter until it becomes a 3" piece of crust - half the pie missing toppings.  Sauce was bland. Cheese was alright tho! 

Won't go back unless I'm hammered drunk and even then - the odds of me walking an extra block to get to this place are extremely low.
author: Cam P.

description:
Ok.  I'm now waiting for 90 minutes to have pizza delivered!  The lady asked me if I wanted to speak to the manager and/or the driver!  No apology offered.  I'm hoping that it gets here within 2 hours.

I ordered online so there is NO damn excuse.  When I called to ask where my food is, I was placed on a 5 minute hold!!!  Arghh.

Just get out of the delivery business if you can't get it done N Beach Pizza.
author: Ed H.

description:
Online ordering/delivery service definitely needs improvement. 

I placed my order online at 10:38am for noon delivery, and promptly received an e-mail confirmation at 10:43am. 

11:59am - They called me for my credit card number, and once they got the information down informed me that my order would be delivered in about an hour. 

UHHHHHHH, what? 

When I told them that my order should have been delivered by noon, the girl's only excuse was they just received the order right now, which didn't make sense since I received the e-mail confirmation over an hour before. 

She puts me on hold to get her Manager, then comes back and tells me that they'll do their best to get my order out but it'll at least by 45 minutes. 

When I asked her about the discrepancy between my e-mail confirmation and when she received the order, she admitted that they also received the e-mail confirmation at 10:43, but repeated again that they didn't get the faxed order until now. Still doesn't make much sense to me, but I didn't want to argue anymore. 

12:55pm -  I call to confirm my delivery is on the way. My coworkers are close to 
eating paper at this point. 

1:20pm - I call again to find out what's going on, am told that driver is on the way. Mind you, my office is 0.4 miles from this location.

1:30pm - Pizza finally arrives. 

I'll be looking for another local pizza place for my office lunches from now on. 

Their pizza is good, but not good enough to justify the crappy service.
author: Anny T.

description:
When we were in Foster City, we loved North Beach Pizza in San Mateo.  It was good and never disappoint.  When we moved to SF, we were happy to find North Beach Pizza closed to home.  Their previous location just across the street from the current location was doing so well - there was always a line and the ambiance was so much more quaint and pizza parlor feel...the new one while more open, high ceiling...just doesn't cut it.  I wonder if others feel the same as we definitely noticed a lot more empty tables and chairs.

Ok, ambiance aside - we are also not as much of a fan of their pizzas, especially hubby who favors thin crust pizzas.  We have dined at both locations, had our standard order of half clam/garlic/tomato and sausage/mushroom/tomato, fried calamari and minestrone.  

Our most recent visit, we tried their thin crust pizza to better satisfy hubby's preference.  It was thinner but still not quite.  What we noticed, light on the toppings - seriously, we can count the number of mushroom slices and sausages.  The minestrone was watery, not the norm at all.  

Not sure when we will return given so many better options nearby.
author: Gloria H.

description:
I don't know why I keep doing this to myself. I stopped ordering on-line from NB Pizza because they kept screwing up my order. I successfully ordered a few times through a 3rd party service (Seamless). For some reason I still liked their food, it's just not worth dealing with them anymore.
Tonight they shorted me a salad through Seamless. I've just finished having a shouting match with NB's "Manager" (having managed the 2nd busiest restaurant in SF for 4 years, I had to add the quotes). Seamless has reimbursed me for the shortage. This time I've learned...never again North Beach.
author: jim K.

description:
Nothing beats Pizza in North Beach. There are probably pizzas that taste just as good but this is pizza from North Beach. 

North Beach pizza is made from whole milk mozzarella cheese, fresh ingredients, hand spun dough and North Beach's specially prepared tomato sauce, creamy garlic sauce or pesto sauce. These are the size that are offered Small = 6 Slices 12"; Medium = 8 Slices 14"; Large = 10 Slices. Enough to feed two or feed a family. 

Ordered the Amigo special- ground beef, onions, olives, tomatoes and jalapenos. Very flavorful and a crust that can't be beat. The crust was not too thick or to thin. I saw the pizza ovens and they were huge, not wood fire stove  but they do a great job with the crust.

Good service. I think they need to add a couple more flat screens for sporting events.
author: Jim D.

description: 3 calls to the restaurant, and TWO hours later, I received my pizza delivery. Smh! It was so upsetting because this was my second time ordering from North Beach Pizza, however, my first experience was great. Too bad today's horrible wait ruined my chances of ever ordering from them again. Gosh, and their baked ravioli was the bomb.com....but not worth waiting an eternity over
author: Ane T.

description: Good thicker crust pizza (not Chicago style).   We always get combo or pepperoni...but there is a good selection of pizzas to try.
author: Mitzi A.

description:
SHEESH!!! I've been going to north beach pizza for a long time. I think recently they've changed owners but the quality of food is still good!!!.
 my go to pizza is the cable car with the garlic-y cream sauce and chicken=DELISH.  the crust is just right with the right amount of salt to get the right FLAVA.the spaghetti is good with little bits of green onions gives it a little unexpected kick. I've done take out and the restaurant both excellent. it's also a good family place to take the kids!!!
author: Jo K.

description:
Yes! Free pizza for lunch thoughtful of my company to order pizza for us all to keep us dry on such a rainy day. Pizza arrives quickly... lets check out the spread. All meat yup that's going on the plate! Pepperoni yup! Ooo chicken, and since I'm a fat a$$ I'm taking 4 slices =)...Something new on the menu I see, the "Brunette special" cheese onions, mushrooms sausage mix in about a couple of LONG ass pieces of hair and BAM you got yourself a Brunette special! 

I will never eat here again, I realize accidents happen occasionally, but what the CRAP were you guys going when you made my pizza cutting hair? Is there a beauty salon in the back I don't know about? I found 4 long pieces of hair in my pizza. Not on the top either, so somewhere between you throwing on the cheese and mushrooms you bust out some scissors?  

Simply nasty...HELLS to the nah.

Posting picture as well!
author: Jabari M.

description: Went here on a Tuesday for lunch. We got the Hawaiian pizza and the pesto chicken pizza which were both delicious. The cheesy garlic bread was also amazing. Great for kids too. The dining area wasn't crowded at all and they have a separate area if you just want to get pizza by the slice.
author: Kayla A.

description:
It's just around the block for me and yet I seldom ever order from North Beach Pizza. I think there are just better places and I'm winning to wait even if delivery takes longer than just picking up something from NB Pizza. It's a decent joint but its appeal seems most suited for tourists visiting its namesake district. 

I think the two standouts here are the North Beach special and the Golden Gate Special. The former is chock full of pepperoni, green pepper, sausage, mushrooms, onions and black olives. It's an all out hearty meat pie. The latter is probably my favorite of the two. Its a garlicky white pie with chicken, pesto, mushrooms, garlic & onions. I love garlic and pesto so I'm predisposed to like this pie. 

I think it's less about the ingredients. They are generous with them here at NB Pizza. My issue is the crust. It's pretty average and there are other places in the city where you want to eat the crust but in a pinch, North Beach Pizza will do just fine especially if you can't wait for delivery somewhere else. But then again, Tony's is but just a block away isn't it?
author: Jon L.

description: A neighborhood favorite! Usually no lines and they deliver. I sometimes have their garlic bread as a meal onto itself :)
author: Zoey S.

description:
Brought my 89 yr old mother to the city she was born and raised in and my 78 yr old mother-in- law. Both Italiano (Heritage from Luca and Genoa).
My mother ordered the lamb chops
Mother-in-law ordered calamari steak
I ordered eggplant parmesano.
All had nice Merlot with our lunch.
Food exceptional
Waiter even better, very attentive. Very nice hearing my 2 moms speaking Italian. So beautiful.    (Then over to Victoria's for a desert)
We highly recommend you go there for an enjoyable meal.
Asked for a business card - Peter Petroni. 
Call (415) 392-1700
Mangia! Mangia!
author: Da B.

description: I go to this place while I wait for my laundry just across the street. Most of the staff are nice. The place is well-cleaned especially the restrooms. The food is good, but would be better if the breads are not that cold. On a busy day, the wait can be long. So i make sure i come in before they start being busy.
author: Rafi M.

description:
I was next door doing a photo shoot and was so hungry, I couldn't take it anymore so I ran over to this place to grab a slice of some meat pizza and a diet coke.

It was delicious as I wolfed it down. Then again I was starving.

I can't say that the pizza was just downright amazing but it was definitely good enough. I didn't drive to this place but I can imagine parking can be hell in this area.
author: Julia P.

description:
My mom and aunt have been coming here for years (back when it was across the street) and have taken me here quite a few times. Best. Pizza. Ever. Great prices and good service. Only criticism is that they don't carry the Antipasti salad anymore :(

This last time, we had Caesar salads and shared a medium pizza with garlic, sausage, pepperoni, and green onions. We washed it down with a nice bottle of Chianti. You can't go wrong!
author: Sarah W.

description:
OK Pizza, not great just ok!

I had the pesto and sausage pizza and I was utterly disappointed. There was a excessive amount of cheese and an infinitesimal amount of sauce that I could have sworn that I was eating dough and cheese with sausage. Not impressed.
author: Joshua B.

description:
Good pizza and fast delivery on a week night.  

The vegetarian pizza is rather good.  Tasty sauce and a nice crisp crust that is on the thick side.  

I've only had North Beach Pizza when attending company events.  They are a big favorite where I work.  Over the years I've tried several combinations and never had a bad experience.  This week I finally got around to ordering for delivery and had a great experience.  My pizza was delivered hot.  This never happens with some of the other places in town.  Delivery was 40 minutes from the time my order was placed on a week night.
author: Donna P.

description:
I had heard that North Beach Pizza has REALLY good pizza, so I had high hopes. I should have been warned when I mentioned this to some friends we randomly ran into at the Boardroom and they made a face and suggested we try Golden Boy instead. But off we went to North Beach Pizza to get slices to go. 

I do not understand what all the fuss is about. I didn't think this was good pizza at all. I got the sausage and pesto which was fine, but really nothing to write home about. Boyfriend ordered the cable car which had tomato, bacon, and something else and I didn't like that one at all.
author: Rachel E.

description:
The City by the Bay and I have lived through many stages together. Our relationship started when I was a Teen when my Family came to visit from Iowa. That was me with the t-shirt and shorts wandering around Chinatown looking for that treasured puzzle box.  In later years, I would fly out and visit and old girlfriend before I actually moved to the Bay Area. That relationship didn't work, but others started as I enjoyed coming up to the City from my Belmont apartment and seeing the sights. Then I moved to the Russian Hill/ Cow Hollow cusp and enjoyed many long exploratory walks and a girlfriend who lived on Telegraph Hill. Finally, I moved to the East Bay where San Francisco is always here, but not utilized nearly enough.

North Beach Pizza is where I brought a friend from Chicago who loved the experience, but complained about it afterwards as not to lose street cred with his Windy City friends. My friend Mary Anne and I would hang out here and look at the old Pet Store across the street. I also took my parents, both brothers, and visiting high school friends here for this San Francisco experience. Those memories were usually washed down with an Anchor Steam and accented with good pizza, great fellowship, and a comfortable and welcoming atmosphere. I now know that there are probably better choices out there, but none have yet matched the right social combination and value as North Beach Pizza.
author: Eric B.

description:
Hate to give one star but service SUCKS. Previous posters are correct.
While they still know how to make a good pizza, they can't run a delivery service worth a sh*t.
Called 5:30 - simple order- placed over the phone since their online system refused to accept a credit card - Told to expect pizza in 45 mins - 1 hour.
Had to call an hour later, pizza arrived 1:15 mins after I ordered it.
Totally unacceptable. And the delivery address was less than 12 blocks form the restaurant!
So, in the future: dine in, take out, but:  DO NOT GET DELIVERY!!!
author: joe g.

description: tasty medium-thick crust, GREAT lasagna, fast delivery!
author: Victoria B.

description:
I was really hoping to like this place.

I was in SF doing some work for Bing.com.  I was really hungry and held out eating all day in hopes that I could find some delicious to eat in Little Italy.  I finally found parking in front of this little pizza place.  It looked promising, so I figured, "Why not?"

I ordered a slice of pizza and a soda.  The pizza was absolutely awful...the cheese looked like leather.

Wont be back!
author: Allison H.

description: This place is very underrated... The pizza is pretty good and it has a very family feel to it... It is not very pricy and it is a great environment to watch a game and eat some pizza!
author: Edgar M.

description: I have a long history of loving pizza and North Beach pizza was always my favorite. I hadn't been there for over five years and my family and I recently visited their new location across the street from their old location if it was just as fantastic and the new facility was beautiful
author: jose b.

description:
Specialty Pizzas!

The restaurant is in a convenient location right in the heart of North Beach located on Grant Ave and Union St. The restaurant has a quick take out by slice and pizza or a sit down restaurant. They offer good quality regular crust pizzas with specialty toppings and flavors.

Gold Gate Pizza: Chicken, Mushrooms, Onions, and Garlic. - Great flavor with fresh ingredients. The chicken and onions stand out and make the pizza delicious.

I've also tried the take out pizza by slice which is also quite good. The selections vary however depending on what they have out at the time.

Overall a great place to go for late night food.
author: Stephen C.

description: Always a great decision for food! Being in store superior services, friendly, kind, and delicious. Delivery can be another story but it is still worth it. I give this a 5 not a 4 because I feel that people do not understand how far out they deliver despite being downtown, with a ton of traffic, and construction going on nearly every block. I cannot tell you how many times they have been late when I order delivery, but the food is still extra warm no cooling factor, the driver is always apologetic, and they try their best. I truthfully believe people miss the entire point of coming to North Beach with their ratings. If you want immediate delivery cause you are starving consider somewhere else, but if you are willing to wait you get what you pay for and more. It is not their fault they are popular and the city is doing too much construction at once. Keep an open mind and enjoy if you go delivery
author: Joe L.

description:
Really, really good spaghetti marinara!  I'm not a fan of the cheesy garlic bread though.  I wish they had capers.

The bolognese sauce is pretty on-point too.  My new fave is the cheese tortellini with bolognese.  I always order to-go.
author: Paige W.

description: Messed up my order. I called in and told them. They put me on hold for 10 mins. Never answered my questions or corrected the problem.
author: Annmarie W.

description:
Mixed experience.  Sometimes it's a 3-4.  Others it's a 1.  Why gamble?  Find another place that is consistent.  

Years ago this place used to be great.  They used a lot of toppings, ample cheese, high quality ingredients, etc.  The pizzas arrived on time and were cooked well.  Fast forward from about 6 + years ago to today and things have changed.  They use half the cheese they used to.  The toppings are also about half the amount and the quality is a little less than I remember in general.  The cooking is inconsistent.  Sometimes the dough is not done and/or the thing is all soggy, especially in the middle.  Gross!  Prices have gone up and they stopped giving out coupons with delivery.  They now charge a "delivery fee." Delivery times are VERY inconsistent.  Sometimes they are there in 30 min while others, such as last night, they took an hour 20.  They price gouge on toppings when designing your own pizza from their topping menu.  A medium pizza is $30+ at three sparse toppings!!!!!  Crazy! 

When I am ordering a delivery pizza I'm usually in a place mentally where I do not want to be hassled and jacked with.  With N. Beach Pizza it's like rolling the dice.  I may get a decent (but expensive!) pizza in 30 min or less.......or I may (more likely it seems) get a soggy, cold, limp, expensive salty blob of sparse, low grade toppings in a box an hour and a half later.....after having to call to see if they lost my order.  

Who needs the potential hassle?!  I don't.  I just want to know I am going to get a decent quality properly cooked pizza in around 30 min. or so.  

If I am willing to roll the dice there better at least be the prospect of getting an over the top mind blowing quality pizza.  Unfortunately, even at it's best NBP is just a little above average.  Why gamble when the maximum payout is merely "acceptable?"  I'll pass.  Sorry, NBP, but I am moving on........
author: John B.

description:
I used to think that North Beach pizza was the gold standard of pizza making in San Francisco. Over the last ten years their pizzas have been hit or miss. The most recent miss occurred 5/23/13 - order placed at 8:49 PM Ticket #157. 

I am not trying to be mean or sarcastic, but this pizza was the worst I have ever had in SF. Two ingredients, sausage and green pepper were stingily  placed on the pizza and the cheese was paper thin. In many parts of the pizza  here was just pizza dough with a few drops of sauce (no cheese, no sausage, and no peppers). Is anyone doing quality control before the pizzas leave the kitchen?  The biggest complaint I have with them is that their product in NOT CONSISTENT! 

These guys really "phoned it in" and the quality was on par with Dominos. Over the years I now find myself buying take out pizzas from COSTCO, and baking them at home for a fraction of the price. I do this because mostly because COSTCOs  product is consistent, and the quality control is better. The pizza you buy today is going to taste like the one you bought the week before.

Over the years I have gotten some good pizzas from North Beach Pizza  but this does not make up for the ones that are poorly made. As much as I would like to patronize a long standing business it doesn't make sense for me to pay a premium price for a product that is not consistently made well. I am past the age of calling the management to complain. Its easier for me to take my dollars to another establishment that takes their business seriously.
author: Bob K.

description:
Great place for kids.
Food was hit and miss. Pizza was very good and I like the crust. Sandwiches were only ok, and the appetizers were decent but small. The prices were a bit on the high side, but you can get a coupon on restaurant.com that will save you a few bucks.
author: Bruce C.

description: Great pizza, hit the spot that was craving pizza, since the early morning. The pizza warmed us up from the cold evenings baseball game, and the best part, they delivered to our hotel. They thought we might have had to meet them in the lobby, but surprise, it came right to our door. Just a plain pepperoni to our rescue!
author: Rachelle Z.

description:
Good Sicilian (Square) slices for West Coast.

I attended the North Beach Festiival this past weekend.. Was looking for a solid  place to grab a slice. I came across Golden Boys because the line out the door was about 30 deep.. I figured the local had to be on to something.. They had a outside window where the girl worked feverishly to get the people there slices.. I picked up a slice of cheese and a combination slice.. Both were very tasty and nice and hot.. Overall the price is what is expected (about $3.00) and the taste was good.. Not great but good.. I know a Sicilian slice will have more dough than a traditional Napolitano, but San Fran has a very doughy consistency that has thrown me off, as I am used to East Coast (NY) pizza.  Good spot though especially after a few pops.
author: Billy F.

description: The pepperoni on their pepperoni pizza is full of MSG. I'm allergic and noticed it right away because there was so much. Pepperoni doesn't need to have MSG.
author: Tom K.

description: I've eaten here before and it wasn't noteworthy enough to write a review... but today I was in the neighborhood and stopped in for a slice and got bad service to go with a mediocre pizza. My slice of cheese came out burned, the crust was black, and so were parts of the underside. I asked for another slice and the guy who was behind the counter acted offended and told me the pizza isn't burned. He just kept repeating it... dude, I don't care if you don't think it's burned, it's black, and to me that's burned food, just give me another slice and don't make a big deal... sheesh. He did replace the slice but without saying a word to me and glaring at me like I'm a pest. No thanks. The pizza itself was too doughy, with not enough sauce.... nothing special and I would have gone the route of no review again, but the service sucked.
author: J D.

description: I have eat there in few years but I remember the Pizza always stand out.   I would recommend this place.
author: Joseph C.

description:
With all the great pizza places in SF, it has to be stellar for me to rave about it. Unfortunately, despite the friends that raved about North Beach Pizza, it was just OK for me when I recently tried it. 

The crust was a hand-tossed style, as opposed to the thin and crispy traditional Italian crusts. We tried a 1/2 and 1/2 combination of the Cable Car Pizza (minus the bacon) and the North Beach Special. The toppings were fresh and plentiful, but the pizza in general was nothing out of the ordinary.
